column2: Engine Board Malfunction
PWB-A (Engine Control Board)
1 Check the PWB-A connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change PWB-A.
Flash ROM Malfunction
PWB-A (Engine Control Board)
1 Check the PWB-A connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change PWB-A.
Main Motor Malfunction
Main Motor (M1) PWB-A (Engine Control Board) Power Unit (PU)

1 Check the M1 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check M1 for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 Check the PWB-A connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 M1 operation check. PWB-A PJ8A-5 (REM) PWB-A PJ8A-8 (LOCK) 2-G¡«H 5 Change PWB-A. 6 Change PU (LVPS).
0B
Transfer Fan Malfunction
Ventilation Fan Motor (M6) PWB-A (Engine Control Board) Power Unit (PU)

1 Check the M6 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the fan for possible overload and correct as necessary. 3 Check the PWB-A connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 M6 operation check. PWB-A PJ10A-1 (REM) PWB-A PJ10A-3 (LOCK) 2-H 5 Change PWB-A. 6 Change PU.
0C
Power Supply Cooling Fan Malfunction
Power Supply Cooling Fan Motor (M4) PWB-A (Engine Control Board) Power Unit (PU)

1 Check the M4 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the fan for possible overload and correct as necessary. 3 Check the PWB-A connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 M4 operation check. PWB-A PJ4A-1 (REM) PWB-A PJ4A-3 (LOCK) 7-I 5 Change PWB-A. 6 Change PU.
Polygon Motor (Laser) Malfunction
Laser Unit (PH) Unit PWB-A (Engine Control Board)
1 Check the cables and connectors for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change Laser Unit (PH) Unit. 3 Change PWB-A.
Laser Malfunction
Laser Unit (PH) Unit PWB-A (Engine Control Board)
1 Check the cables and connectors for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change Laser Unit (PH) Unit. 3 Change PWB-A.
Transfer Roller Failure
Retraction Position Sensor /2nd Image Transfer (PC5) Pressure/Retraction Solenoid /2nd Image Transfer (SL4) Main Motor (M1) PWB-A (Engine Control Board)

1 Check the M1 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check M1 for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 Check the SL4 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Check the PWB-A connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 5 PC5 sensor check. PWB-A PJ14A-3 (ON) 2-G 6 SL4 operation check. PWB-A PJ11A-2 (REM) 2-G 7 M1 operation check. PWB-A PJ8A-5 (REM) PWB-A PJ8A-8 (LOCK) 2-G¡«H 8 Change PWB-A. -
Transfer Belt Cleaning Blade Pressure/Retraction Failure
*Retraction Position Sensor /Cleaning Blade (PC6) Pressure/Retraction Solenoid /Cleaning Blade (SL3) Main Motor (M1) PWB-A (Engine Control Board) * PC6 is part of the transfer belt.

1 Check the M1 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check M1 for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 Check the SL3 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Check the PWB-A connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 5 PC6 sensor check. PWB-A PJ9A-11 (ON) 2-F 6 SL3 operation check. PWB-A PJ10-5 (REM) 2-F 7 M1 operation check. PWB-A PJ8A-5 (REM) PWB-A PJ8A-8 (LOCK) 2-G¡«H 8 Change PWB-A.
Transfer Belt Rotation Failure
Transfer Belt PWB-A (Engine Control Board)
1 Check the PWB-A connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change Transfer Belt. 3 Change PWB-A.
Toner Carousel Failure
Toner Carousel Motor (M2) Toner Carousel Positioning Sensor (PC3) PWB-A (Engine Control Board)

1 Check the M2 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check M2 for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 Check the PWB-A connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 PC3 sensor check. PWB-A PJ5A-11 (ON) 4-C 5 M2 operation check. PWB-A PJ5A-1¡«4 (Pulse Output) 4-B 6 Change PWB-A.
Fuser Failures: 18: Fuser Warm-Up Failure 19: Fuser Low Heating Roller Temperature 1A: Fuser High Heating Roller Temperature 1B: Fuser Faulty Thermistor
Fuser PWB-A (Engine Control Board) Power Unit (PU)

1 Check that the input voltage to the printer matches the configuration of the engine (110/220 V) 2 Check the Fusing Unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 3 Check the Fusing Unit, LVPS (PU), and PWB-A for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Check the lever and position of the Safety Switch (S2) and correct as necessary. 5 Change the Fusing Unit. 6 Change PWB-A. 7 Change LVPS (PU).
OHP Detect Sensor
OHP Sensor (PC2A) PWB-A (Engine Control Board)
1 Check the PWB-A connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 PC2A sensor check. PWB-A PJ12A-6 (ON) 2-D 3 Change PWB-A.
Waste Toner Near Full Error
Waste Toner Near Full Detection Board (PWB-C) Imaging Unit PWB-A (Engine Control Board)

1 Check the PWB-C connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the PWB-A connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change the Imaging Unit. 4 Change PWB-C. 5 Change PWB-A.
Faulty NVRAM Counter
NVRAM PWB-A (Engine Control Board)
1 Unplug the power cord and plug it in, then turn OFF and ON the Power Switch. 2 Check NVRAM (PJ26) on PWB-A for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change PWB-A.
2A
Faulty NVRAM Data
NVRAM PWB-A (Engine Control Board)
1 Unplug the power cord and plug it in, then turn OFF and ON the Power Switch. 2 Check NVRAM (PJ26) on PWB-A for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change PWB-A.
2B
NVRAM Access Failure
NVRAM PWB-A (Engine Control Board)
1 Unplug the power cord and plug it in, then turn OFF and ON the Power Switch. 2 Check NVRAM (PJ26) on PWB-A for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change PWB-A.
2C
NVRAM Install Failure
NVRAM PWB-A (Engine Control Board)
1 Unplug the power cord and plug it in, then turn OFF and ON the Power Switch. 2 Check NVRAM (PJ26) on PWB-A for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change PWB-A.
